<<<<<<< HEAD
The seaman's spiritual companion, or, Navigation spirituallized being a new compass for seamen consisting of thirty-two points : directing every Christian how to stear the course of his life through all storms and tempests : fit to be read and seriously perused by all such as desire their eternal welfare / published for a general good, but more especially for those that are exposed to the danger of the seas by William Balmford, a well-wisher to seamen's eternal welfare and recommended to the Christian reader by J.F. ; to which is prefixt a preface by Benj. Keach, the author of War with the Devil. Balmford, William.
[14], 143 p.
Printed for Benj. Harris, London : 1678.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
=======

Keach, the author of War with the Devil. Balmford, William.
[14], 143 p.
Printed for Benj. Harris, London : 1678.
